intro: Rhododendron tsoi var. hypoblematosum, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen rhododendron, is a rare and ornamental plant native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with acidic, well-drained soils. It prefers partial shade and cool, moist conditions, making it suitable for shaded garden settings. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
